boardgame.name: Star Wars Villainous: Power of the Dark Side
boardgame.description:
In Star Wars Villainous: Power of the Dark Side, each player takes control of one of five Star Wars characters: Darth Vader, Asajj Ventress, Kylo Ren, Moff Gideon, or General Grievous. Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character.

On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, and other things. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

One of the actions allows you to choose another player, draw two cards from that player's fate deck, then play one of them on that player's board, covering two of the four action spaces on one of that player's locations. The fate deck contains heroes, items, and effects from that villain's storyline, and these cards allow other players to mess with that particular villain.

Depending on their villain's unique power, players can also use their villain's "ambition" to perform actions that power effects based on the villain's use of the Force, strategic leadership, or sheer luck. The game also incorporates villain-specific missions and rules for iconic ships and transports from all corners of the Star Wars galaxy.

boardgame.name: Super Skills
boardgame.description:
Super skills is the ultimate skill game for all ages. Players compete in randomly selected challenges from a collection of 120 possible tasks.

Challenges are set as either "complete the task" or either as "beat the opponent".

The first player to complete 10 challenges is the winner.

boardgame.name: Infernal Wagon
boardgame.description:
Oh no, the mine is collapsing!
Hurry, get in the wagon and head towards the exit!

Infernal Wagon is an intensely fun cooperative game in which players must work together to create a path to the exit… before time runs out! But be careful: each card played has a high chance of triggering devastating effects!

A game of Infernal Wagon plays in 7 minutes at most, until one of the end game conditions is met. In this cooperative game, all players win or lose together.

At the start of the game, place the 3 starting cards and the wagon on the last one. There is no turn order: when the time is right, the player with the best card plays and activates its effect. They draw a card and any other player can take a turn (in the 2 players variant, you can play 2 cards consecutively). Once a card is played, move the wagon onto it. Place the exit card in the 7 minutes time span to win the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ich hab mein Herz im Spiel verloren
boardgame.description:
The players start with their pewter figures on the colored spaces in the corners of the game board and take turns to roll a die and move their figures. If a figure has completed a trek clockwise around the game board, it advances to the next inner circle. Some spaces benefit or hinder the players. In a game with two players, the first to reach the heart in the center of the game board is the winner.

If more are playing and one of the two players, who arrive at the heart first, has the heart as a playing figure, the two players are a couple and win the game together. If two other figures are first, the last two are the couple and the winners.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Glitch Squad
boardgame.description:
The forensic scientists of the Glitch Squad have each been assigned a crime scene to analyze. Unfortunately, the office cat—Glitch—has accidentally changed the password to all of the evidence lockers.

Each round, you write 3 clues to help one of your teammates guess a piece of evidence related to the crime: location, weapon, occupation, or hobby. Unfortunately, Glitch the cat messes up these clues. Acting as the meddlesome cat, your opponent gets to erase one of the clues, and write in a "Glitched" clue to stump your ally.

Can you guess the evidence from the clues, knowing one of them is glitched? If so, you reveal the next letter in the password to your evidence locker! If not, the opponent who glitched your clues gets the next letter in their password. The first team to guess all of their passwords wins!

Created in collaboration between LabX at the National Academy of Sciences, Tiltfactor, and Resonym. Game concept by Rick Thomas.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Smash Up: 10th Anniversary
boardgame.description:
Smash Up celebrates 10 years with an all-new set including new factions, a new way to play, and lots of goodies for fans of the game!

We're announcing the factions over time before the release, and so far we've previewed Skeletons, World Champs, and Mermaids! We'll update this BGG entry when more are previewed.

The set will also include special items such as a Goblin collector coin (FINALLY you can actually flip a coin with your Goblin faction!), the 10th Anniversary Art Book, the all-new Big Base mode of play, and more!

Yeah we'll update those too when we preview them!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Planting Evidence: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Planting Evidence is a card game for 2-4 players that pits you against your criminal friends.

Each round, players must choose between planting incriminating evidence on their fellow criminals or using similar evidence to build up their alibis.

Build sets of cards to assemble fingerprints from partials, reconstruct DNA, build a car license plate profile, or submit weapons for review.

Be careful not to trigger the end of the game unless you have the least evidence against you, or you lose!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1980's A Decade of Trivia
boardgame.description: 1980's A Decade of Trivia is a far out card game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for fans of the rockin' 80's.

boardgame.name: Heroes of Krynn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document presents a new race and subclass, as well as variety of new feats and feat-related options, to playtest for DUNGEONS & DRAGONS:


Kender. These short-statured beings have a knack for producing the right tools in every situation. Sorcerer Subclass. The Lunar Magic subclass allows sorcerers to explore deeper ties to moons.
Backgrounds. The Knight of Solamnia and the Mage of High Sorcery backgrounds provide access to feats specific to their organizations.
Feats. This collection of feats presents options available to those with specific backgrounds and backstories, as well as an option for characters with a special connection to a deity.

boardgame.name: Basketboss
boardgame.description:
Competition is fierce, money is tight, and your critical task as team manager is to build a dream lineup of basketball superstars.

Basketboss is an auction game where each season you’ll be responsible for managing all the complexities of a professional basketball team.

Your principal task is to offer the best contracts to players at auction. You’ll also have to make sure you can hire the right team advisors - as they provide special powers that can dramatically improve your lineup if used properly. For example, the Physical Therapist can help you avoid crippling injuries!

Will your lineup be stacked with Hall of Famers and your shelves full of gleaming trophies?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Geneva 1955
boardgame.description:
It is early July 1955, and Geneva is preparing to host a historical summit. The leaders of the USA, UK, France and USSR – the four most powerful countries in the world - are meeting to foster peace between East and West and to stave off the rapidly growing divide now dubbed The Cold War. Naturally, the summit will be neck-deep in spies, rumours and complex loyalties. But as head of the Swiss security forces, you must descend into this miasma of truth and half-truth, for you have learned there are traitors here, anarchists that would gladly catapult the world into lawless chaos. Can you identify all of the anarchists before they derail the summit and threaten global security?

Each card in the deck represents a person who was actually present at the 1955 Geneva Summit, from Ike Eisenhower, US President, down to Germaine Goutte, French Personal Assistant. A pile of random anarchists is dealt at the start of the game, with the remaining cards acting as informants from which you might extract clues. A cunning series of icons lets you compare the front of an informant with the back side of a hidden anarchist to detect whether they match by suit, value, or as a multiple or factor of the value. By clever hand management and astute use of clues you may deduce the suit and rank of each anarchist. But can you find them all before your clues run out and they act?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Roc Climbing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fabled Golden Egg was proudly on display at the Keystone Gardens Art and Wine Festival when it was stolen by a monstrous bird-like creature seemingly made of obsidian! Worth an untold fortune and, even more worrying, said to hold a curse that could bring even the strongest of warriors to their knees, the retrieval of this egg is paramount! Are you up for a bit of Roc Climbing?

Roc Climbing is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 7th to 12th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 10.

boardgame.name: Kitsune
boardgame.description:
They say they have seen the beautiful kitsune in the forest: Let's go find them to win their friendship!

Only those with luck on their side will be able to find them. If you risk enough, you might get to see the little foxes, but if you approach them carelessly... you can scare them away and you'll lose them! In addition, the mischievous Oni are always hanging around, to change everything with their pranks.

The objective of the game is to collect 3 kitsune of each color (Red, Blue and Yellow), if 2 to 4 players play. For 5 and 6 players you must collect 2 kitsune of each color. If at the end of your turn you have the required number of foxes, you win immediately.

To do this you must reveal cards trying not to repeat any color. At any time you can stop and resolve the cards in any order you choose:

Kitsune help you win.
Renewal cards allow you to draw cards from other players
Prosperity cards help you protect your little foxes
Oni cards are played instantly to help or harm others.

boardgame.name: Rear Window
boardgame.description:
Experience Alfred Hitchcock's masterpiece film Rear Window in a game of deduction and suspense. Carefully observe strange clues and ominous patterns in the things going on in the apartments across the way. There are parties, knives, a saw, bickering, laughing, music...and a mysterious trunk. Do you detect a murder? Or is the secret, private world of the neighbors planting frightening ideas in your mind?

In Rear Window, one player takes the role of director Alfred Hitchcock — the "Master of Suspense" — and communicates via building windows clues and signs for the other players without ever uttering a word, ideally giving them enough to go on that they can figure out who the murderer is — or whether a murder even took place.

If a murderer is out there, you need to nail down all eight attributes of that person by the end of four rounds without them catching on to what you see and know.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Ascendancy: The Dominion War
boardgame.description:
Through their Vorta commanders and Jem'Hadar super soldiers, the Founders rule as Gods, bringing order to the galaxy. The discovery of the Bajoran Wormhole brought this ancient civilisation onto conflict with the more youthful civilisations of the Alpha Quadrant.

Expansion to the popular Star Trek: Ascendancy game, The Dominion War Variant adds the Dominion as a playable civilisation, the Bajoran Wormhole leading to he Gama Quadrant as a new area to explore and a Dominion war variant that changes the playing field by dividing the civilizations into two rival alliances with players striving to see their Alliance dominate the opposing Alliance.

The expansion contains everything you need to add the Dominion, and another player to your games of Star Trek Ascendancy. Discover the Gamma Quadrant via the Bajoran-Idran Wormhole Systems, encounter new Exploration Cards, plus more Space Lanes and Resource Nodes!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Trek: Ascendancy – Dominion Dice Pack
Star Trek: Ascendancy – Dominion Escalation Pack

boardgame.name: Star Trek Ascendancy: The Breen Confederacy
boardgame.description:
Little is known about the secretive Breen, not their appearance, and not even whether they are a single species, or several. Intensely territorial, the Breen annihilated the Klingon fleet sent to conquer them, leaving the Klingons no wiser as to who or even what they were facing

Expansion for Star Trek Ascendancy Board Game, including everything you need to add the Breen and another player to your games of Star Trek Ascendancy.

Discover new star systems, encounter new Exploration Cards, plus more Space Lanes and Resource Nodes

"Never turn your back on a Breen"
- The Romulans

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Trek: Ascendancy – Breen Dice Pack
Star Trek: Ascendancy – Breen Escalation Pack

boardgame.name: Vektek Security Kit Escape Game
boardgame.description:
Somewhere in the not too distant future, Chris Ramsay sent a distress beacon from the Hadrian Base Station. This is where YOU come in! Can you help Chris track down and eliminate the A.C.E clones?
This is a stand-alone escape game that comes complete with the following:

Mobile/Desktop Digital Experience
Vektek Security Booklet
Game Cards
1 Deck of USPCC playing cards


This is an escape room game produced by youtuber, magician, and puzzler Chris Ramsay.

boardgame.name: Squendo
boardgame.description:
Squendo is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players that you can take everywhere in a unique, recycled, handmade bag from Australia.

The aim of the game is to have the highest amount of scoring tiles on the board at the end of the game. Do this by stacking to earn double points, or making a square (Squendo) to score 10 points.

The game shines when a triple stack is formed. This is your opportunity to throw out either one or two of your oppositions tiles and watch them squirm.

From minute five, you will be strategising and once you finish, you will want to play again.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ)
boardgame.description:
セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ) is a two player card game from Japan. Players are duelling but with only three cards. The goal is to get gem cards, but not to go bust.

Players take on the role of two magicians fighting to get the gems. In the deck, there are seven magicians to choose from, and 28 skills (from 14 cards). Each player gets a magician card and two skill cards, using this combo to try to win gems valued 0-3 (from 30 gem cards). But if they make a total over 7, they go bust.

The designer styles it as a fast game like blackjack with a lot of replay from 100s of possible combos to try.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond)

boardgame.name: Heroes in a World of Horror!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maybe you can’t bring yourself to believe the horrid truth.

Perhaps you’re too innocent to face reality.

Or possibly you’re trying to run away from what you know is out there.

It’s time to wake up, open your eyes, and turn to face the monster pursuing you.

In the face of the swallowing darkness, all those who can must help push back its encroaching evil.

Heroes in a World of Horror! is a sourcebook for Players and Directors about to embark upon a story of They Came from Beyond the Grave!, providing you with new playable Archetypes and a diverse selection of characters you can play straight from the book for the 1970s era and the 19th century era of the game!

Heroes in a World of Horror! includes:

Three playable Archetypes — the Skeptic, the Kid, and the Escapee.
Eight ready-made characters complete with character sheets so you can start playing immediately!
Scene setting and story-provoking fiction to immerse yourself in a world of horror involving the characters between these pages.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Sprawl Goons: Upgraded - Metal Express
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Put the pedal to the metal in your Sprawl Goons campaigns, with Metal Express!

Inside you'll find (lite) rules for vehicle types, plus tables of abilities, quirks, bolt-ons and interiors, to customise your ride. There's new rules for manoeuvres, races and chases, vehicles in combat and dogfights, control rolls, ramming, pedestrians, collisions, along with the really big guns - missiles, cannons, decoys, and more - and the necessary vehicle crits table, for when it all goes horribly wrong. We've even given you the means to hack your enemy's transportation! Plus, guidance on repair work times and cost and some Sprawl mechanics to do the work. Finally, visit the Showroom for a wide selection of sample vehicles, from motorcycles and jet skis, to submarines, blimps, tank suits, jets, VTOLs and main battle tanks.

Vroom. Dakka dakka. Kaboom.

boardgame.name: A Gathering Storm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ebon Staff! An artifact, a fetish, a symbol of the long-dead goddess Amphoe Wan. The staff brings hope to her downtrodden and beaten people even in the face of the gathering storm. For her enemies muster in the north, they intend to extinguish the light of this goddess and her people forever.

To harness its power, one must return the staff to its sepulcher and give it back to the goddess. But the sepulcher, the temple to Amphoe Wan, lies hidden in the vast rolling expanse of the steppe. Finding it proffers a challenge to any who carry it and those who do have the burden of a whole people on their shoulders. Crossing the unforgiving steppe, guided by faith, desperation, or brilliant insight, one must find the ancient temple from which the goddess first came into the world and return the staff to where it belongs.

But the road is long, the steppes unforgiving, and what dangers lie within the temple is anyone’s guess. The Gathering Storm, designed for a mid-level party of 4-6 characters, is an overland and dungeon adventure that began with M1 A Stranger Among Us and continued in M2 The Ebon Staff. This adventure takes the characters further into the steppes and to the holiest shrine of its people.

boardgame.name: Twelve Fingers
boardgame.description:
An original level 5-7 adventure made for D&D 5e.

Lord-Regent Lopon rules the Kells through subtle manipulation, keeping the nobles at each other’s throats. Should the nobles realize Lopon’s duplicity, they would cast down this tyrant. Recently, several prominent aristocrats have turned up dead, and fingers point in all directions.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: GhostWire: Tokyo - Prelude
GhostWire: Tokyo - Prelude: The Corrupted Casefile
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The prelude VN to GhostWire: Tokyo to familiarize the player with KK and the rest of the team from the game.

boardgame.name: セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond)
boardgame.description:
セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond) is an expansion pack for セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ) that adds new magicians and skills, and lets three players duel.
user summary

boardgame.name: DaG 8 Chess
ダグエイトチェス (DaG Eight Chess)
boardgame.description:
ダグエイトチェス (DaG Eight Chess) is a two player abstract game from Japan, a mix of Chess and Stratego on a smaller 5*5 chequer board.

Players have a small Chess army that move across the board, but as face-down tokens. The pieces are one each of King, Queen, Rook, Knight and Bishop, and three Pawns. These pieces all move and attack as in normal Chess.

But if a player can deduce which piece is which, they can declare a piece's identity instead of moving. If correct, that piece is eliminated. A player wins by getting the eight army pieces, or by getting the King.
user summary

boardgame.name: Soul of Ankiril: The Strategy Game
boardgame.description:
Soul of Ankiril – The Strategy Game is a Strategic Card Game where players will compete using thematic decks of 25 cards, one of each element or Temen (Fire, Air, Water, Earth, Wood and Metal), with the aim of deactivating the Emanation Portals on the opponent’s field. To do this, players will move their creatures on a board made up of hexagons, then it will be up to them to make the most of the map to achieve victory.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ダマフィア (Da Mafia)
boardgame.description:
ダマフィア (Da Mafia) is a crime game from Japan, with players concealing their gangster cards to control the city.

The game works as a worker placement game, but the workers are cards for the different gang members; Bosses, Members, Hitman, and Bodyguards. Each player is the head of their gang and places their initial four cards face-down around the city. When they are turned, they might control that section, and gain benefits such as recruiting more gangsters.

But before cards are turned up, players have a chance to guess who is concealed where in the city. If they are correct, the player outsmarts the opponent ands gains an advantage.

Each player has their own board for their gangster head, which shows their abilities, recruitment, and player levels and score. The other side is the same but with a special unique ability, meaning players can play a simpler or more complex game.

After five rounds, the player who has gained the most notoriety in the city wins the game.
user summary

boardgame.name: Bolets
boardgame.description:
Mushroom season is finally here, Granny has asked you to fill the pantry and promises to cook a delicious mushroom pie once you get back. The forest is dangerous and it’s easy to get lost, but you can’t disappoint Granny!

Bolets is a 9 card game that you can play in about 10 minutes. It’s fairly easy to learn and the setup is quickly.

In this abstract card game, you have to overlap the eight map cards and trace a path to travel from card to card, until you reach Granny’s Cottage, with at least one life left. On the way, be careful with the crows and collect as many mushroom points as you can, to beat your own score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Reise durch die Schweiz
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1 in Schaffhausen. The first to arrive in Lindau at space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by the roll of a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Contains 6 metal player pieces. Published before 1928 based on publisher location on cover.

boardgame.name: The Bells Toll for Madrid: Franco´s Offensive against Madrid, Oct-Nov 1936
boardgame.description:
The Bells Toll for Madrid is a two player free PnP game simulating the advance of Franco´s rebel forces aiming to capture Madrid in the early stages of the Spanish Civil War 1936/39.

The game includes a rules set, 192 two sided counters and an A2 (17”x 22”) map; all components will be made available in the files section of this page. Only a six sided die needs to be provided.

boardgame.name: Alone on the Wind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a crow

You hatched one month ago, and now you and your siblings are ready to leave the nest. There used to be humans here, but they all left. That’s what your mama told you, and what her mama told her. Many lifetimes ago, the humans gathered into their rockets and flew to the stars.

In the decades since, the Earth Mother has begun to retake the land and bring magic back to it. Green grass and vines cover the cities the humans left behind. Nature and magic thrive, offering comfort to those who wish it, and adventures for those who seek them.

Those such as yourself.

You take flight from your nest, eager to explore.

boardgame.name: Accomplice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the beginning of time, the forces of evil have sought to cause fear and destruction and each time it attempts to do so, a hero rises to stop them.

You are not one of those heroes.

Accomplice is a single-player roleplaying game where you are the assistant to one of these heroes, helping them do research and preparing a trap for one of these evil beings. By doing research from your personal library, looking for clues around town, and interviewing those that have insight into the world of the supernatural, only you can devise a plan that will allow you and your partner to stop evil from consuming the world.

boardgame.name: As the Crow Flies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There used to be humans here, but they all left. That’s what your mama told you, and what her mama told her. The Earth Mother has begun to retake the land and bring magic back to it. Green grass and vines cover the cities the humans left behind.

You are a crow.

Take flight from your nest and explore.

Find a new home.

boardgame.name: TNDC - The Neverending Dungeons of Chaos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

TNDC, once one of the most popular MMORPGs on the market, is dying. A blend of roguelike elements kept this game at the top of everyone's radar, but a lack of development has led to its eventual downfall. Perhaps you are one of the game's most dedicated players, sticking it through 'til the end. Or maybe you've only stumbled across the game in its final days.

No matter how you got here, you're one of the few players still logging in to explore-

The Neverending Dungeons of Chaos!

boardgame.name: Diapers & Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Diapers & Quests is a one-shot tabletop roleplaying game thematically based on a popular 90s cartoon about adventurous toddlers.

You and your friends are not only toddlers; you are adventurers! Not content to hide safely behind the gates and walls the adults have put in front of you, you constantly seek ways to escape to find excitement and fun. Today, however, something has gone wrong, and you’re the only toddlers clever enough for the job. Break free from your bonds! Escape captivity! Get back in time for naps!!!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crashers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Dungeon Crashers" is a game about good natured monsters fighting against mean spirited bully monsters to save wayward adventurers. As you save adventurers, you befriend them and learn from them, gaining new skills and abilities as your journeys continue. The more people you save, the more abilities you can learn!

boardgame.name: The Inexorable Span
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An urgent request sends adventurers to The Interminable Wastes, a domain of bright lights and fast cars. The Wastes weren't always this way though, but the Sleepless Syndicate will kill anyone that tries to dredge up the past.

Part 2 of 3 of the Calamity Jar series.

A 4-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 characters. Optimized for APL 8.

This desert domain's turned into a neon nightscape since The Sleepless Syndicate stole it from its Archfey. This is a fast paced adventure including a thrilling car chase, a sandy dungeoncrawl, and delving into the domain's dark history.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Built for War: Solo/AI module
boardgame.description: This deck of cards adds the ability to play solo and with AI for smaller player counts!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Built for War: Design, Build, and Destroy World War II Tanks

boardgame.name: Sommarlov: Jakten på Sommarskuggan
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Summer Holiday!

All players draw a card without showing it to the others. One of the players will be the Summer Shadow!

The idea of the game is to capture the "shadow". If the Summer Shadow manages to run off the playing field before those who chase, that player wins. If not, the player who catches the Summer Shadow wins.

The hunters can gain extra speed by completing various missions. The summer shade, on the other hand, can hinder the hunters by releasing a little shadow slime that delays the hunt.

Many of the tasks are solved together by several players.

Välkommen till Sommarlov!

Alla spelarna drar ett kort utan att visa för de andra. En av spelarna kommer att bli Sommarskuggan!

Idén med spelet är att ta fast skuggan. Hinner Sommarskuggan springa av spelplanen före de som jagar så vinner den spelaren. Om inte så vinner spelaren som hinner ifatt Sommarskuggan.

De jagande kan få extra fart genom att klara olika uppdrag. Sommarskuggan å sin sida kan hindra jagarna genom att släppa lite skuggslem som fördröjer jakten.

Många av uppgifterna löses tillsammans av flera spelare.

boardgame.name: South Sea
boardgame.description:
Region Guide for Svilland

Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the South Sea, where life is hard, nature is harsh and the seas are challenging. In this expansion of dark and brutal setting Svilland, you will realize that the South Sea is even darker and more brutal in its own style.

This book contains new rules for naval warfare that reflect the famous viking long ships and their legendary sea battles in D&D terms, and new character options suitable for the cultures of the islands of the South Sea. Also, you will find many details about the friends and foes within the islands.

Grab your axes and give your sacrifices to the seas. In the end, Valhalla awaits!

boardgame.name: Inborn Magics: New Sorcerer-Specific Spells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“You only really hear people talk about bloodlines and lineages when it comes to nobles and royalty. Damn their titles and their crowns. Let’s see if their blood lets them do this.”
- Delion, Warlord of Shaturra

Sorcerers are casters who draw their arcane abilities from powerful energies infused into their bloodline generations before they were born. As varied and distinct as the sources of their spells, sorcerers are gloriously free from the obligations that bind wizards or warlocks, not requiring any sort of tutorship or pact in order to access the arcane weaves that flow through the planes. Instead, sorcerers tap directly into their own essence, their very bodies acting as material components and their natural instincts guiding their manipulation of the magics permeating the world around them.

The following are new sorcerer-specific spells that your character can unlock as they learn the secrets of controlling the raw power coursing through their veins. As with all new play options, please consult your Game Master to verify that these spells mesh well with the vision and direction of their game.

This supplement includes:
5 new sorcerer-specific spells

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Replacement Tray Pack
boardgame.description:
For sleevers wishing to replace their first-printing Series 1 Feature Film trays with the updated insert design.

10 Replacement Trays for the Series 1 Feature Films that better fit sleeved cards.

—description by the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Final Girl: Carnage at the Carnival
Final Girl: Frightmare on Maple Lane
Final Girl: Slaughter in the Groves

boardgame.name: Into the Wolf's Maw
boardgame.description:
A Norse Mythology Themed Adventure for Four to Six Characters of Level 5

Publisher's blurb:

There is an ongoing power conflict over the land of Alsvartr between Hanlon the Real King in the North, and Gudrick, in the South. That leads to low-intensity conflicts between the North and the South of Alsvartr. However, Gudrick assembles a great army to march towards the North and gain the ruling of Alsvartr once and for all. Hanlon the real King, through his intelligence service, obtains the information of the intentions of his rival. Then he seeks the help of the fellow earls of the Kingdom of Nionaem. He mentions the different points of interest for raids, which will enrich the earls of Nionaem and prevent a possible defeat as Gudrick would be forced to retreat to deal with these attacks. Even though they are notable locations for Gudrick, the raids would be pretty easy to perform since Rodmar Icebreaker, ruler of the Sea Shield, has gone to the North with the majority of his troops to join the war.

Meanwhile, in the Sea Shield region, there is matter beneath the mountain which is used to craft weapons by the Fangs of Fenrir, a vicious cult. It is said that the matter is one of Fenrir’s Fangs.

boardgame.name: The Magic of Palladium Books (Issue 1 - Jun 1988)

boardgame.name: PARKS: Wildlife
boardgame.description:
Expand the award-winning game Parks with Parks: Wildlife! Grab your binoculars and prepare for even more animal sightings at Iconic Wildlife Parks, featuring all-new artwork from Tom Whalen and the Fifty-Nine Parks Print Series, and the newest national park addition, New River Gorge. This expansion is the MORE expansion. Get ready for new trail sites, fresh canteens, new gear, and more season cards.

Wildlife also introduces a large wandering Bison that moves along the park cards and grants bonuses to the players that visit those parks.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Parks Wildlife

boardgame.name: Viva La Dungeon!: Level One
boardgame.description:
People from all over the realm come to the Dungeon with the hopes of winning gold, magic and glory. They are not heroes. They are not trained. They do not have supernatural powers. And only one of them is going to survive.

Viva La Dungeon! is a battle-royal dungeon-crawling game of hidden movement, treasure-looting and player versus player combat for up to 4 players.

Players move around the Dungeon, finding equipment, and finding each other to pick-pocket or fight while the Gelatinous Cubes slowly make the map smaller and smaller.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Klostermust
boardgame.description:
Klostermust is a family game, or light weight strategy game with both luck and a lot of tactics. Klostermust uses dice and action drafting as its core mechanics.

The game takes place in a monastery, where you play as monks and nuns who compete to collect apples and make soft apple cider. The goal of the game is to impress the bishop who will visit the monastery on the seventh day and mark the end of the game.
To be successful you need a fair bit of tactics but also a bit of luck.

The game is published in Sweden.

boardgame.name: The Book of Nonterraqueous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was supposed to be a simple job: collect a book from a wealthy woman’s contact. Other forces covet the book, however, and the investigators find themselves in grave danger as the simple collection job becomes something far more sinister. Are their lives and sanity worth the price of completing the task? Will they betray the woman who hired them or stay loyal throughout the sinister events?

This Modern Era, 7th edition Call of Cthulhu scenario takes place in Boston. The investigation can be completed with no combat, making it suitable for a single player, although up to four could play without adjusting the scenario’s difficulty. It can be completed in a single session.

boardgame.name: CATAN: Dawn of Humankind
boardgame.description:
Guide the first humans on their journey as they migrate throughout the world while developing their technology and culture.

CATAN: Dawn of Humankind is a reboot of The Settlers of the Stone Age, with gameplay rooted in the original CATAN, while featuring new elements, strategies, and adventures to discover.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Settlers of the Stone Age

boardgame.name: アドテール (Adtale)
boardgame.description:
アドテール (Adtale) is a dice game from Japan in which players direct red and green slime against each other.

Each player rolls dice and chooses a suitable attack card to be used with that dice. They all send their red and greeen dice and cards out together, to form a mass of slime in the middle of the players' area. As the mass of slime builds up by accumulating more dice, the slime is forced around, until it finally impacts on a player.

By using the combination of player abilities, dice abilities and dice, players try to eliminate the opposition before they succumb to attacks themselves.
user summary

boardgame.name: CATAN: 3D Erweiterung – Seefahrer + Städte & Ritter
CATAN: 3D Expansions – Seafarers + Cities & Knights
boardgame.description:
CATAN: 3D Expansions – Seafarers + Cities & Knights features two expansions to use with CATAN: 3D Edition that bring new — yet familiar — experiences to the table.

In CATAN – Seafarers, you send ships to explore uncharted islands to build new settlements and discover valuable gold.

In CATAN: Cities & Knights, you develop cities and join forces with your neighboring factions to defend Catan against ruthless barbarians!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wroughtuns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Wroughtun, ogres with metal plates fused to their bodies, and an even worse temper than usual. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Madness Cultist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Madness Cultist, a deranged and empowered follower of an ancient evil. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Gem Eater
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Gem Eater, a bizarre and monstrous creature that turns flesh to crystal. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Cave Complex Shoreline
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 591st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the shoreline of an underground lake.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Golem Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Interested in an abandoned golem factory?

This forsaken factory is dour, grey and disused. The moulds for golems have gathered dust, the forges are out, while partially-assembled golems have begun to rust. Broken stone shipping crates have fallen into disarray at the end of the assembly line, while the small administrative office near it is damaged.

Who knows if the conveyor belt running through the factory even works anymore!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a Scooby-Doo-esque ghost hunt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Abandoned Magical Weapons Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This abandoned weapons factory is dour, grey and disused. The moulds for different weapons have gathered dust, the forges are out, while partially-made weapons have begun to rust. Broken stone shipping crates have fallen into disarray at the end of the assembly line, while the small administrative office near it is damaged.

Who knows if the conveyor belt running through the factory even works anymore!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring the unification of noble households with a magical sword, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Magical Weapons Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a magical weapons factory map?

This factory is filled with moulds for different weapons, glowing forges, partially-assembled weapons, and shipping crates to send them out in. A conveyor belt runs through the whole factory, helping those manufacturing the weapons do so efficiently at every step of the assembly line. There’s even a little office in the back for administrative tasks!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving gnomes and their dangerous inventions, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ironworks Sewer System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a sewer map with a twist?

This sewer map is centred on a strange well at the end of the dungeon. What is it for? Does a monster live in it? Is it a well filled with a magical or dangerous substance?

The surrounding walls are lined with pipes and valves. Grates cover lines of sewerage along the stone pathways. Perhaps this place once managed the waterways, before it was left to ruin.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a mysterious substance that makes one age dangerously fast, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Serial Killer's Abandoned Sewer Prison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a serial killer’s lair?

This serial killer’s sewer prison is stained with blood, and complete with an easily sprayable workbench. Jars and tools line the walls of the “work” room, while further in are plenty of cells for victims.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a murderous researcher seeking to revive his dead love, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Great Hunt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an unusual tomb?

This overgrown tomb features a large orb engraved with the continents of the ancient world. In it rest the bodies of heroes and ancient warriors, their tombs long since broken into by thieves.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving being hunted by ancient—now woken—machines, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Sepulcher of the Three
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a creepy tomb?

This catacomb features three glowing red skulls, which look 100% suspicious. Seriously, something’s going on here. There are ancient weapons and wicked looking blades, cracked tombs, and gross water flowing beneath grates in the floors.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a vampire trying to awaken his lost lords with sacrifices, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Textures 08
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Finally… that coarse and rough and irritating thing that gets everywhere. Plus some gravel, cave floors, opaque water and fog overlays for good measure.

boardgame.name: Textures 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fancier wooden flooring, hexagonal stone floors and couple more extra goodies.

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 24
boardgame.description:

This pack contains 6 new Creature Tokens: Balor, Glabrezu, Hezrou, Marilith, Nalfeshnee and Vrock! each with multiple color variants

Total # of tokens in this pack: 76

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 25
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This pack contains 7 new Creature Tokens: Eye Monster, Rakshasa, Ogre, Duergar Sorcerer King, Minotaur, Minotaur Skeleton and Wight! each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 76

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 26
boardgame.description:

boardgame.description:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version

(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

This pack consists of 16 Various Townsfolk Tokens

Every token is available in multiple color variants!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 17
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Dungeon Decor delving a little bit into Mechanus territory

Cogs in many variations and sizes as well as some giant clock parts

boardgame.name: Wilderness Pack 8
boardgame.description:

Water stuffs!

Various foamy goodness, waves, waterfalls, jets etc.

Total # of Assets in this pack: 235!

boardgame.name: Etherfields: Kittenburg Expansion
boardgame.description:
In this promo dream, players will have the opportunity to explore the city of Kittenburg, the cat metropolis of Etherfields. The town is tormented by internal dilemmas that players will try to resolve. The dream is divided into 2 parts, the first more detective, in which players will get to know the inhabitants of Kittenburg. The second part, more tactical, consists of solving the city's main problems.

Can be used with the Flying Cat from the KS campaign.

boardgame.name: Pletore
boardgame.description:
Pletore is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

Two stones, or a stone and an empty point, see each other if they lie on the same row or column and there are no other stones between them along that line. You pinch a point if it sees stones of your color in at least one horizontal direction and one vertical direction. You control a point if you pinch it while your opponent does not. To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions: a) Pass, provided that there are no empty points or every empty point is controlled by some player. b) Place a stone of your color on an empty point not controlled by your opponent. c) Flip an enemy stone on a point you control. On even-sized boards only, to prevent mirror play, the position after White's first move must be such that flipping the two stones on the board is not equivalent to rotating the board by 180º. The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of empty points you control, plus komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.

Komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as compensation for going second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games. The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. It is only used when komi and the board size have the same parity (i.e. they are both odd or both even). On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button.

Pletore was inspired by Michał Zapała's Tumbleweed.
