boardgame.name: Character Class RPG
boardgame.description: Character Class RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG with an emphasis on character choice and detail. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a six-sided die.

boardgame.name: Crypt Rift RPG
boardgame.description: Crypt Rift RPG is a printable solo horror fantasy RPG in which the player takes the role of a group of guards trying to seal a rift within an ancient crypt that is releasing demonic creatures into their world. It is played using two six-sided dice, a pencil, and a copy of the character/rules sheet.

boardgame.name: Death Ship RPG
boardgame.description: Death Ship RPG is a printable solo sci fi RPG that simulates an arcade game in which the player tries to escape a spaceship they have been enslaved on. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: Death To Kalor Nex! RPG
boardgame.description: Death To Kalor Nex! RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of an adventurer seeking a royal bounty put out for slaying an evil warlock. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and three six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Dragon In A Deck RPG
boardgame.description: Dragon In A Deck RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of an adventurer searching a dragon's cave to slay the dragon within. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a deck of poker cards, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Delvers RPG
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Dungeon Delvers RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of a party of dungeon-delving adventurers. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a six-sided die.

User summary:

Originally published via RPGLaboratory.

boardgame.name: Rise or Fall of [INSERT NAME HERE]
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

he Rise or Fall of [INSERT NAME HERE] is a storygame for one player. It follows the story of a character — a student at a new high school, a questing knight, a struggling artist, a young child who has found the door to a magic kingdom — with shifting goals and priorities, charting their story towards an uncertain end.
boardgame.rpg: Rise or Fall of [INSERT NAME HERE]

boardgame.name: Rewwixta
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Rewwixta is a solo story generation TTRPG where you recount tales of revolt, rebellion, and uprising against colonial powers. It is based on brilli, a Maltese folk game.

While Rewwixta is inspired by various historical rebellions carried out by the Maltese population, the game is explicitly anti-canon, and we encourage you to tell your own stories of colonial revolt.

boardgame.name: Treasured Depths
boardgame.description:
A deck building game where you utilize a 3x3 grid of cards as your "hand". Each turn you'll refill your grid then choose a row and column to activate. You'll collect the resources indicated and carry out textual abilities in your chosen order. Following that, you can acquire new cards to add into your deck, and/or use your accrued dive points to locate treasures at different depths. You're competing for the most fame (Victory points) by finding the best treasures by the end of the game.

I created this game because I really liked the grid system of Monumental, but literally nothing else about it. So, it's main inspirations are Monumental and Ascension. I intend to creat some art for it at some point.

boardgame.name: Det Sidste Håb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Trods ødelæggelsen af Dødsstjernen, er oprøret i stor fare for at gå til grunde. Overalt slår Imperiet ned på Rebellerne der fortsætter kampen mod overmagten.

Star-Destroyeren "The Avenger" angriber en af rebellernes skjulte baser og finder efter en hård kamp informationer, der kan knuse oprøret en gang for alle.

Et desperat angreb mod "The Avenger" er oprørets sidste håb for overlevelse.

Galaksens fremtid afhænger af en lille gruppe rebeller...

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files:

28-page scenario
13-page print-and-play character sheets

boardgame.name: Helvedes forgård
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vore helte ankommer til minebyen Hellhole midt i den californiske Great Maze. Byen summer af liv, fulde minearbejdere, syngende dansepiger og skrigende røg fra dampmaskinerne. Her stinker af sprut, sved og sulfur. Et vivar af folk bevæger sig rundt i byen – de flestes hudfarve er gemt under et tykt lag af gulligt støv og sort sod.

En enlig præst står på et gadehjørne, og prøver at råbe folk op med sin prædiken. Et par tungt bevæbnede ordenshåndhæver står og griner foran en bar. Og ned af gader flytter alle folk sig, for byens elegant klædte borgmester og hans kvindelige ledsager.

Ingen lægger rigtig mærke til de fem fremmede, som kommer i land fra færgen. De skal aflevere en værdifuld pakke til bankdirektøren – men snart bliver de rodet ind en mere alvorlig sag.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as three PDF files:

19-page scenario
7-page print-and-play character sheets
1-page print-and-play map

boardgame.name: Tombstone Ekspressen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"I det vilde vesten kan kun en seksløber beskytte dig. Vil du overleve må du være villig til at skyde først."

Den gamle mand nikker for sig selv, efter han har delt sin visdom med de andre passagerer. Ingen svarer ham. Det er varmt og ørkensolens hede trænger igennem togets vinduer og forvandler kupéen til en smelteovn. Det er flere timer siden at de sidste isterninger bukkede under for varmen.

Passagerne er døsige i varmen mens togets bevægelser langsomt nedbryder kroppens evne til at holde sig vågen. Nogle af dem har været med siden toget forlod stationen i New Orleans for tre dage siden.

En af passagerne skæver til sit ur. Der er kun 7 minutter til toget når svinget inden Silver Creek. Det er tid til at gøre masken klar og tjekke revolveren.

– o –

Scenariet foregår i Weird Western settingen fra Deadlands rollespillet, hvor en gruppe veteraner fra borgerkrigen har fundet arbejde som håndlangere i jernbaneselskabernes nådesløse kamp om adgangen til Arizonas rige minebyer.

Det er ikke nødvendigt med noget særligt kendskab til hverken setting eller Savage Worlds reglerne.

Der er tale en handling som blander action med de valg hovedpersonerne tager undervejs.

Spillerne skal selv være med til at skabe deres roller ud fra et skelet, hvor det er i spillerens magt at bestemme rollens køn, samvittighed og mål.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as three PDF files:

24-page scenario
11-page print-and-play character sheets
7-page print-and-play play aids

boardgame.name: Landsknecht
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Der er krig i Kejserriget, hvor kurfyrsterne slås om magten. En gruppe landsknægte har gjort krigen til deres levevej, men må sande at krigslykken ikke er med dem.

De er endt på tabernes side, hæren flygter—og forude venter nederlag, fattigdom og en kold vinter.

Men, som Ranald altid siger, intet er så skidt, at det ikke er godt for noget. De fem lejesvende har fundet et brev, der viser vej til kurfyrstens krigsbytte. Kan de få fingrene i byttet inden fjenden, vil lykkens gud atter tilsmile dem.

Inden da skal de dog først slippe helskindet igennem krigens sidste dage.

Scenariet foregår i Warhammer universet, men det er ikke nødvendigt med noget særligt kendskab. Der er tale en handling som blander action med de valg, hovedpersonerne tager undervejs.

Reglerne er baseret på Savage Worlds, som der heller ikke behov for at kunne på forhånd.

Spillerne skal selv være med til at skabe deres roller ud fra et skelet, hvor det er i spillerens magt at bestemme rollens køn, samvittighed og mål.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files:

24-page scenario
16-page print-and-play character sheets

boardgame.name: Sentinel
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are the lone guardian of a place of great power - known to you only as The Sanctuary. Many years you have kept vigil in this place, guarding what is kept within from any and all who come to disrupt it or steal it for themselves.

Sentinel is a solo, journaling game about a solitary guardian and the place they are charged with keeping safe. It is a deck and dice based game in which you will create your guardian and the sanctuary that they protect before reliving the memories, facing threats, and finding interesting objects while time passes around you. And then, when the time has come for your watch to end, find out what happens to The Sanctuary when you are no longer able to guard it.


Though designed as a solo game, Sentinel can easily be played collaboratively with two or more people.**

boardgame.name: The Books Were Wrong
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

History has a way of misaligning cultures in its pages. There are many reasons for this: misunderstanding, neglect, and malice to name a few. But as facilitators and players at the table, we have an opportunity to include our own perspectives and voices into the narrative we tell. We have an opportunity to promote empathy and understanding of the fantastic cultures in our stories.

You play a scholar visiting a culture or location that you’ve read about. However, you realize that your history books depict people and places with egregious errors. As you spend time with the culture, you jot down notes to set the record straight so that the next adventurers passing through can approach the culture with better understanding and knowledge.

The Books Were Wrong is a game that assumes that history is written by imperfect people and attempts to recontextualize the entry in order to give power back to cultures commonly depicted as "evil".

boardgame.name: Village Witch
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Village Witch is a solo journaling game about a witch finding a home.

You’ve completed your training and are ready to become a village witch. You’ve been sent by the order to find a village to work in and have a year to find the place you want to make your life.

To play, you need one 6-sided die, a standard deck of cards or a deck of tarot cards, and a way to record your story. Answer questions and use the given prompts corresponding with the cards to craft your story.

boardgame.name: As My Body Crumbles
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You were made to be unmade, given purposefully shortened life by a Creator who has abandoned you, leaving you with nothing but questions.

Now you follow the trail of what your Creator left behind, trying to find answers as you feel your body crumble with every passing moment. You do not know how much longer you have to live, but what will you discover before you die?


As My Body Crumbles is a solo journaling TTRPG of discovery and death designed by Kienna Shaw (@KiennaS) and Jason Cutrone (@JustJasonPls). Inspired by stories like Blade Runner and Frankenstein and using the framework of Before the Tower Falls, As My Body Crumbles lets you take on the role of an artificially created being in the last moments of their life. Setting and genre agnostic, you can play everything from a robot to a raised undead as you uncover objects and try to piece together answers about your existence, the past, and your Creator.

All you need to play is the rules, a standard deck of cards, and a pen/marker and paper.

CW: As My Body Crumbles explores themes of impending death that may parallel experiences of terminal or chronic illness, with player character death acting as an integral (and inevitable) part of the game

boardgame.name: Six Figures Under
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Six Figures Under

or

You Went Through Ten Years Of Necromancy School And They Never Taught You How To Market Yourself.

A series of 6 solo micro-games about being a freelance necromancer:

False Life Advertising - Write a Craigslist ad
Dead Ringer - Record a message for your answering machine
A Day in the Life - Journal about a revivification job
Cheap as Dirt - Write a recipe
At Death’s Door - Journal about work following you home
Life Insurance - Write instructions for your own revivification

boardgame.name: Burger Pile-Up!
boardgame.description:
The dealer deals three cards to each player and gives each one a bottom bun. The dealer then replaces the remaining cards in a pile with the number face down.

The first player to build a burger consisting of 10 topping cards, numbered lowest to highest, wins!

—description from the inside of the box

boardgame.name: Positronic Potentials: The Nanny
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

“I heard about it later, and when they called us blasphemers and demon-creators, I always thought of him. Robbie was a non-vocal robot. He couldn’t speak. He was made and sold in 1996. Those were the days before extreme specialization, so he was sold as a nursemaid—” - I, Robot

In Positronic Potentials: The Nanny, you play as a non-vocal robot whose role is that of a nursemaid for a child. You weren’t necessarily designed specifically for this role, though it holds a great importance to you, as does your relationship with the one under your care.

You have a “positronic brain” and your mind is at least somewhat comparable to that of a human. You are able to consider yourself and the world around you. How closely your thoughts and feelings compare to humans, and how you relate to them, is up to you.

While not designed to be able to speak, you are able to communicate through gestures and sign language. The child you care for is able to understand you for the most part.

boardgame.name: The Selkie Envoy
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
The villagers of Stormlook are at their cliff’s edge. One of their own went missing. Another turned up dead. Their fish stocks are dwindling, and they’re hungry to blame one group: the selkie, a people who can transform between human and seal.

Stormlook's leader asks for your help to traverse the Captiva Icemark, a perilous ice shelf, and establish contact with the selkie. Will you swear upon iron to complete this journey and bring peace between both communities, or will you succumb to the icy depths? Play to find out.

boardgame.name: Alone on a Galactic Map
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a famous space cartographer that has been tasked with creating a comprehensive map of your section of the galaxy. To do this you have divided the galaxy into 36 quadrants and will label the most important Cosmic Bodies, both natural and constructed.


Alone on a Galactic Map solo tabletop role playing game about discovering Cosmic Bodies and creating a map.

boardgame.name: PRICE
boardgame.description:
The hero Ivry wakes up from a nightmare and finds himself in a weird room. To escape from fear and darkness, he has to search and explore on his own until he discovers the truth and finds his sister Iva.

Source: [Steam].

boardgame.name: Margherita
boardgame.description:
Margherita is the first game in the Pizza Games collection.

In Margherita, players are trying to win cards.

Each turn, one player flip a card like a coin and, depending of the side it lands on, all the players must do a specific action (slapping the box in the center of the table or not slapping the box in the center of the table). Of course, the player who chooses the good action to do will win cards.

This is a fast pace game where the cards can accumulate on the table and where every action is decisive.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts: Wooden Bits
boardgame.description:
An set of wooden resources, meeples, and cottage.

Contains 194 wooden pieces.

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts: 10 Custom Dice
boardgame.description: 10 additional custom dice for Creature Comforts.

boardgame.name: Chilli or Chunder: Hot Stuff
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the 'Chilli or Chunder' Chilli Eating Contest!

The Hot Stuff expansion includes two new ways to play:

- First Timer (more challenging)
Having never eaten hot stuff chillies before but decided to give the contest a go none the less, this contestant shows determination of steel, but without the matching stomach.

- Professional (less challenging)
A hot stuff chilli eating machine, this contestant should eat up this contest.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Chilli or Chunder: Chilli Eating Contest Game

boardgame.name: Biathlon Crystal Globe
boardgame.description:
Play as a biathlete in an unbearable suspense race. Biathlon Crystal Globe offers you the possibility of competing in all biathlon disciplines (Sprint, Pursuit, Mass Start, Relay, etc.). One day race, season or Championship.
Become master of the Crystal Globe!

Choose his characteristics, rather very good at shooting or very good at skiing, unless you prefer him to be good in both disciplines. Each type of biathlete has its own movement die. Build your race to surprise your opponents. You have energy cards that allow you to make the difference in the terrible climbs to leave your competitors behind. But this reserve is not inexhaustible. It's a safe bet that the fate of your race will be decided on the shooting range.

Shooting lying down or standing up, with or without wind, you will have to choose for your biathlete between a fast but risky shot or a more steady and safer shot. Two very different strategies but both can be winning. Because each missed ball will make you lose a lot of time on the penalty ring. It's up to you to choose the one that will win the day before you make the last lap, with the other biathletes chasing you.

Goal of the game: Embody a biathlete during an unbearable suspense race.
How to play: Choose their characteristics, rather very good at shooting or very good at skiing, unless you prefer them to be good in both disciplines. Each type of biathlete has its own set of movement die, shooting dice and Energy deck.
You have energy cards that allow you to make the difference in the terrible climbs to leave your competitors behind. But this reserve is not inexhaustible. It's a safe bet that the fate of your race will be decided on the shooting range.

Shooting lying down or standing up, with or without wind, you will have to choose for your biathlete between a fast but risky shot or a more steady and safer shot. Two very different strategies but both can be winning. Because each missed ball will make you lose a lot of time on the penalty ring. It's up to you to choose the one that will win the day before you make the last lap, with the other biathletes chasing you.
End of the game: Cross the finish line.

— Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description: The matching Feldherr foam set plus plastic Organizer, ensures that your miniatures don't meet an unfortunate end. It prevents your game materials from getting lost in the darkness of your board game box. Thus, you prevent weapons from snapping and keep your game materials tidy.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: World of Warcraft: Wrath of the Lich King

boardgame.name: Raas
boardgame.description:
You've come up with a new flourish on traditional Dandiya Raas dance steps. Impress the judges by getting other dancers to copy you and perform your steps as dancers spin around the dance floor in time with the changing music.

Raas is a light-medium competitive strategy game for 1-6 players. The 'board' consists of a set of 7 discs, connected with an intricate gear mechanism. Each disc has 6 'dancers', with space for cubes in player's colours. As the discs rotate, dancer pairings change.

The cubes on each dancer indicate their proficiency in each player's dance step. On their turn, players may place new cubes or turn individual outer discs. At the end of each round, the central wheel turns a number of steps as indicated by the active music card.

Players score points by timing rotations so that 'their' dancers pair up, and by positioning proficient dancers in place to influence the central wheel, which represents expert dancers. The winner is the player with the highest score at the end, representing the maximum acclaim received at this dance event.

boardgame.name: Butterfly Princesses of the Swordlands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

North of the mighty River of Sighs and south of the formidable Ploughshare Mountains, lies the Swordlands. A series of fertile valleys and lush forests, the Swordlands is primarily inhabited by an enchanted nation known as The Monarchy.

The Monarchy lives in harmony with the land, having crafted towering halls and grand palaces out of risen earth and living wood---both of which flow and reform like molten stone at the touch of the Monarchy's craftwrights.

By all accounts, resources in the Swordlands are plentiful, art and learning are embraced by all, and foreign invaders are scarce to be seen.

But all is not well here.

Minor factions, united by little more than common bitterness, are fighting in the hills and dales. They duel with magics, with song, and even with the ornamental blades that every member of the Monarchy receives at her birth.

But why do they fight?

Well, unfortunately...

Every Single One Is In Line For The Throne

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Eternal: Modern Age
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“What do moderns know of life and the forces behind it? You call the Salem witchcraft a delusion, but I'll wager my four-times-great-grandmother could have told you things ...”

Cthulhu Eternal is a multi-era, setting agnostic ruleset which aims to support inventive game designers who have original ideas for Lovecraftian roleplaying games or scenarios. It draws upon the long line of D100 games of Cthulhu-themed investigation, offering a beautifully streamlined and elegant set of mechanics to support a diverse range of gaming styles.

Different eras of human history each have their own flavor and character – due in part to the technology available, and in part due to social conventions of the day. Recognizing this, Cthulhu Eternal exists as a family of inter-related rules engines – each based on the same mechanics but tailored to the needs of a specific era.

This version of Cthulhu Eternal is specially designed to support Lovecraftian games set in the “modern day” – that is, the era we live in (give or take a decade or so). This is an attractive era for a game setting: after all, everyone is already familiar with what life is like in our current real world so it’s not something that needs to be particularly explained or portrayed for players.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Eternal: Victorian Era
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Above the waves rose weedy remembered spires. The moon laid pale lilies of light on dead London, and Paris stood up from its damp grave to be sanctified with star-dust ...”

Cthulhu Eternal is a multi-era, setting agnostic ruleset which aims to support inventive game designers who have original ideas for Lovecraftian roleplaying games or scenarios. It draws upon the long line of D100 games of Cthulhu-themed investigation, offering a beautifully streamlined and elegant set of mechanics to support a diverse range of gaming styles.

Different eras of human history each have their own flavor and character – due in part to the technology available, and in part due to social conventions of the day. Recognizing this, Cthulhu Eternal exists as a family of inter-related rules engines – each based on the same mechanics but tailored to the needs of a specific era.

This version of Cthulhu Eternal is specially designed to support Lovecraftian games set in the Victorian Era – that is, the mid-to-late 19th Century when Queen Victoria was Queen Empress of the world’s largest empire. This period is a popular setting for the earliest fiction revolving around themes of cosmic horror, gothic horror, science fiction, detective fiction and weird fiction.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Eternal: Cold War Era
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“ ... a terrible cosmic narrative derived from ... discourses of the mad self-styled spy who had killed himself. I found myself faced by names and terms ... Yuggoth, Great Cthulhu, Tsathoggua, YogSothoth, R'lyeh, Nyarlathotep, Azathoth”

Cthulhu Eternal is a multi-era, setting agnostic ruleset which aims to support inventive game designers who have original ideas for Lovecraftian roleplaying games or scenarios. It draws upon the long line of D100 games of Cthulhu-themed investigation, offering a beautifully streamlined and elegant set of mechanics to support a diverse range of gaming styles.

Different eras of human history each have their own flavor and character – due in part to the technology available, and in part due to social conventions of the day. Recognizing this, Cthulhu Eternal exists as a family of inter-related rules engines – each based on the same mechanics but tailored to the needs of a specific era.

This version of Cthulhu Eternal is specially designed to support Lovecraftian games set in mid-20th Century, and in particular the shadowy world of the “Cold War” that waxed and waned roughly from the end of World War II to the mid-1990s. This "historical era" is one which many older gamers will still recall, perhaps fondly or perhaps with memories of the pervasive sense of dread and paranoia fuelled by fears of nuclear war. The Cold War era was one rife with real-world subterfuge, paranoia, and uncertainty ... what better backdrop to set the scene for a tale of cosmic horror.

The Cthulhu Eternal Cold War SRD aims to support a broad spectrum of different types of Lovecraftian game set during these decades. Whether it's Mythos-tainted tales of ruthless espionage ... or nostalgia fuelled recreations of your favorite decade (whether that's the 50s, 60s, 70s, or 80s), these rules give you the foundation for an evocative tale of horror and dread.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Eternal: Jazz Age
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I threw on the current of the Crookes tube apparatus, and focussed toward that scene of immortal blasphemousness the strongest ether radiations which men's art can arouse ...”

Cthulhu Eternal is a multi-era, setting agnostic ruleset which aims to support inventive game designers who have original ideas for Lovecraftian roleplaying games or scenarios. It draws upon the long line of D100 games of Cthulhu-themed investigation, offering a beautifully streamlined and elegant set of mechanics to support a diverse range of gaming styles.

Different eras of human history each have their own flavor and character – due in part to the technology available, and in part due to social conventions of the day. Recognizing this, Cthulhu Eternal exists as a family of inter-related rules engines – each based on the same mechanics but tailored to the needs of a specific era.

This version of Cthulhu Eternal is specially designed to support Lovecraftian games set in the “Jazz Age” – that is, world as it was in the early 20th Century (between the World Wars). This is an attractive option for a game setting as it was the then-contemporary world in which H.P. Lovecraft set many of his novellas and short fiction.

boardgame.name: To Touch the Untouchable
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Call it art, call it cult. Gertrude was a friend of all. Call her eyes such a fright, she's sailing on a wave of light.”

"To Touch The Untouchable" is a short standalone investigative scenario set in H.P. Lovecraft's notorious college town of Arkham, any time in the 1920s or 1930s. It can be played with access to just the open-source Cthulhu Eternal Jazz Age SRD, which (for convenience) we have bundled with the scenario. The adventure also comes with digital versions of all props and maps, to make it easier to run on a VTT of your preference.

About The Scenario: The Protagonists are engaged by the family of a young Arkham woman, Gertrude Pettingill, who has mysteriously gone missing. A pious and obedient girl, Gertrude is seldom seen anywhere apart from the Miskatonic University Campus (where she studies) and the Arkham First Baptist Church (where she attends Bible-reading class two nights a week as well as services on Sunday). Her sudden disappearance baffles everyone ... not least the Arkham Police. But fortunately the Pettingills have some friends or associates -- the Protagonists -- who know their way around a mystery.

boardgame.name: 魔王大戦ブットバクラッシュ (Satans War Buttoba Crash)
boardgame.description:
魔王大戦ブットバクラッシュ (Satans War Buttoba Crash) is an action game from Japan. Players flick their monsters onto Satan's castle, trying to earn enough reward to gather three 'heroes'. The first player to recruit three heroes, such as Dracula, Succubus, Vorpal Bunny, or Hanako in the toilet, is the winner.

One player acts as Satan and defends a large castle, made from staggered boxes as a dias, with a throne at the top. The other players have a Demon King, one of eight such as Lucifer, Cthulhu, or Nurarihyon. Each Demon King starts with special abilities to help the player.

The game uses highly decorated plastic cards. The player takes their plastic Demon King card and inserts it vertical into a base card. This creates a flicking device. By holding the base down, and bending the card back, a player can flick their small foam creatures up onto the castle levels. Satan can defend the castle platform with its own cards, or use whatever toys or plushies a player has to hand.

As the game progresses, the attackers try to steal money from the castle, and use this to recruit 'heroes' to their side. These heroes bring more powers and abilities to the cause, and strengthen the attack in different ways. For example, the Vorpal Bunny increases the attack magnification to the throne by 100 times and exerts super high firepower, but Hanako in the toilet nullifies the attack on the throne. Getting Hanako-san from the toilet keeps the player with Vorpal Bunny in check. Players can choose to work together, and a player might even be better off attacking themselves. The game system is very open and fluid in the way the characters' abilities work.

The first player to gain three heroes to their side is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Kagami Kyosuke Works (架神恭介ワークス)

boardgame.name: UNO: 50th Anniversary Premium
boardgame.description: The UNO card game is celebrating 50 years of bringing people together for fast fun and unpredictable twists with this premium Golden Anniversary edition of the classic card game. It arrives in a deluxe, specially designed box and includes cards with a velvety smooth finish. A commemorative golden medallion collector coin is included, and when someone plays the special "50/50" card you flip it to see who will have to draw extra cards! Just like the last 50 years, when a player is down to one card, they must yell "UNO!"

boardgame.name: GolfPro Card Game
boardgame.description:
GolfPro Card Game gives players the 18-hole experience while allowing families and friends to spend time together, chatting, laughing, and having fun playing golf around the table.

Wisely choose the best club cards to get on the green, avoid actions that will land you penalties, and then putt out in the least strokes possible! Scores just like golf.

Like the real course, GolfPro is a game of strategy and luck. But now you can play anywhere, anytime. When was the last time you played golf at home?

You can choose from Drivers, Woods, Long Irons, Short Irons, Wedges, or Chips. Your goal is to get on the green in the fewest strokes, then once you’re on the green, draw a putter card and lay it face down on your cards… Don’t look until everyone is on the green!

Like on the course, you’re not always going to have a great shot. There are several hazards that can appear on the club card faces:

Out of Bounds, In the Trees, In the Water, Topped it, Chunked It, and In the Bunker… if you pull one you must follow what it says!

Included are Hole-in One cards, Holed It Wedges, and several Chip-In cards.

boardgame.name: Ripple
boardgame.description:
Ripple is a card game for 2-6 players. Players have a "beach" created by lining up 2 rows of 5 cards each.

Players replace one of their beach cards with a card from the draw pile or another player's discard pile. As player replace cards, they are trying to build matches, block sets, and complete combos.

Once a player reveals all of the cards on their beach, the game is over and players will add up their points. The player with the lowest score after 3 rounds is the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Goblin Familiars
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A trio of goblin familiars to use with Dungeon World or Labyrinth Lord.

boardgame.name: Mr. Supreme
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the premier issue of Instant Villain!

This PDF contains a full write-up of Mr.Surpreme.

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, tactical and plot suggestions.

boardgame.name: Mantles of Destiny 01: Demigod of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create characters whose bloodline traces back to the god of the underworld! The Demigod of Death uses the fifth edition rules and provides characters of any class with power over life and death.

Will you call forth corpses from the earth to lift you over castle walls? Or does a ghostly ship await you at the water's edge? You may have become an undead thing. All this and more awaits a child of the darkest gods.

Mantles are a kind of archtype that can be applied to all classes. Each mantle has a number of options for customization so that your powers can be tailored to your overall character build.

This product contains:

Rules for applying mantles to characters
Demigod of Death mantle powers
FAQ

boardgame.name: Mantles of Destiny 02: Demigod of Strength
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create characters with supernatural strength from divine ancestry! The Demigod of Strength uses the fifth edition rules and provides characters of any class with the strength of Hercules!

Change the course of rivers, leap castle walls, and uproot mighty redwoods. The ravaging kaiju on the edge of the kingdom inspires fear in all but you as you race to wrestle it into submission!

Mantles are a kind of archtype that can be applied to all classes. Each mantle has a number of options for customization so that your powers can be tailored to your overall character build.

This product contains:

Rules for applying mantles to characters
Demigod of Strength mantle powers
FAQ

boardgame.name: Brewkessel: School of Spellcraft and Sorcery #1 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once upon a time, there was a wonderful school of spellcraft and sorcery called Brewkessel. 62 years ago it vanished in a flash of red lightning, taking with it some of the best and brightest names in magic. All that was left behind was a deep, smoking hole.

Was it the result of a spell gone wrong? Had the gods finally rained down judgement on their vile witchcraft? No one could say for sure. In fear of repeating Brewkessel’s unknown mistake, one by one the other schools locked their doors.

Brewkessel reappeared 7 months ago.

What is Brewkessel?

Brewkessel is a megadungeon designed for Old-School Essentials and other classic RPG systems. It is presented as a series of zines that each detail a section of the dungeon and its surrounding area. Although Brewkessel is designed as a complete whole, each issue is modular, and can be played on its own or be mixed-and-matched with the other issues.

Inside Issue #1

Everything you need to start a Brewkessel campaign, including character prompts, an overview of the surrounding area, and adventure hooks.
The witch who controls the grounds and her force of canny mercenaries.
Brewkessel's ground floor, which includes the mundane requirements of a boarding school: kitchen, smithy, baths, owlery, and hospital.
The School of Enchantment, featuring a warlock with a wizard's head in a jar, a mad enchantress, and a portal from the fey realm.
Other adventurers interested in the dungeon's treasures and secrets.
A plethora of strange potions, presented with tasting notes.
Rules allowing characters of any class to learn spells.
How to assign your character to one of Brewkessel's four houses: Kelpulous, Phoenessent, Prescipiece, or Riddleward.
boardgame.rpgseries: Brewkessel: School of Spellcraft and Sorcery

boardgame.name: The Emulator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue #2 of Instant Villain!

This PDF contains a full write-up of The Emulator.

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, tactical and plot suggestions.

boardgame.name: O Tawa
boardgame.description:
What is O Tawa?
This is a tabletop role-playing game, and is, to the best of my knowledge, the first even TTRPG created entirely in the language Toki Pona. I'm Lara Paige Turner, and I making this zine because I love Toki Pona and I wanted to share that love by making a game for Toki Pona speakers.

In this game, you play a group of adventurers. Together, you sail to new places, meet strange new people, defeat dangerous creatures, and help out the many small islands of the great ocean. Fortunately, you have magical powers to help you. When you speak Words of Power, you change the world around you.

O Tawa is meant to be an low-stakes, relaxing sort of game. You'll explore new places and make a story together. All you need are 6-sided dice, some pencils and paper, friends, and these rules. Oh! And you'll need to know how to speak Toki Pona, or be willing to learn.

boardgame.name: Cloud Giant's Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

Fifth installment features a flying castle ruled over by a cloud giant Baron, and is larger than the other installments to date.

boardgame.name: Fire for Light: Red Water Depths
boardgame.description:
Red Water Depths is a campaign-driven expansion for Fire for Light that includes five new chapters. During each chapter, you set up a new scenario with new enemies and objectives. Most importantly, players are given choices that will change the outcome of their games and give them access to different rewards or shape future chapters differently.

Red Water Depths introduces the new Fire exposure, as well as new lava terrain, that will fundamentally change the environment. Inside you can also expect;


5 new chapters in a new small Storybook
new tokens
new Foes
new Item cards
new Trait cards
and so much more!


Red Water Depths introduces a whole new region inside a dark volcano where elves have claimed regency after slaying the dragon Arkunda! The Flame King is quickly extending his rule. The explorers must rally the people to defend themselves against an army of goblins and ogres before it's too late!

Make your choices and save the people in Red Water Depths!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Happy City: Tour de contrôle de Rudolph
boardgame.description:
Promo card for Happy City.
The card is a special red building.
To build it you will need :

2 yellow building.
2 green building.


The card is in French.
Here is the translation :

"En fin de partie !": At the end of the game.
"Piochez trois cartes bâtiments (6/7/8/9)et ajoutez-en une à votre ville (même s'il s'agit d'une 11ème carte)": Draw three buildings cards (6/7/8/9)and add one to your city (even if it's an 11th card).

listing.notes: under cello, never played. shipping only to E.U.

boardgame.name: Βαλκανικοί Πόλεμοι 1912-1913
boardgame.description:
Four players compete to keep/gain cities of the Ottoman Empire in Europe. The player with most cities under his control after 7 rounds is the winner. The game introduces a 4-outcome mechanism to conclude the result of each attack on a city using a fortune wheel. No dices used at all. Other game mechanisms include cards, pick of advantages from a table, etc.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Fire for Light: Lichen's Landing
boardgame.description:
Lichen's Landing is a campaign-driven expansion for Fire for Light that includes five new chapters. During each chapter, you set up a new scenario with new enemies and objectives. Most importantly, players are given choices that will change the outcome of their games and give them access to different rewards or shape future chapters differently.

Lichen's Landing introduces the new Toxic exposure, as well as a new Summary Page, that will fundamentally change the explorers. Inside you can also expect;


5 new chapters in a new small Storybook
new tokens
new Foes
new Item cards
new Trait cards
and so much more!


Lichen's Landing introduces a whole new region of strange jungle filled with mykonids and creatures who seem to be poisoning the water supply - but the different groups of mykonids are all blaming each other for this tragedy. Beneath the surface, someone is lying and the explorers need to figure out what's really going on.

Make your choices and save the jungle in Lichen's Landing!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Little Factory: Playmat
boardgame.description:
Prizes for the winner of tournaments.
The winner received:

- 1 Little factory play mat

Participants received Little Factory : Suburbs Promo

boardgame.name: Summer's End
boardgame.description:
The village of Summer's End is struggling to keep the villagers fed, and Malwinter is looming. You've been drafted to gather as much as you can to keep the coffers full - but you might have to use some of those materials to craft tools if you want to bring the most back.

In this competitive roll & write game inspired by Fire for Light you'll spend and roll your dice every turn to move around the map, collect different resources, fight off the creatures of the forest, and try and bring back more for the village than the other explorers!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Memories of Old Map
旧地图回忆
boardgame.description:
A set of eight postcard wargames themed the end of the Qing Dynasty:
Sanyuanli anti British 1841
Fall of the Kingdom of Heaven 1864
Fall of the Black Banner: Taiwan 1895
Memories of Guangzhouwan 1898
On the other side of Hong Kong 1899
Outside the Forbidden City 1900
Trample on Heikoutai 1905
The Wuchang Uprising 1911

一套八款以清末为主题的明信片兵棋：
三元里抗英斗争（广州1841）
天京江宁 太平天国的覆灭（南京1864）
黑旗陨落 乙未战争（台湾1895）
回忆广州湾（湛江1898）
港岛对岸 划出新界（香港1899）

boardgame.name: The Coven at the End of the Lane
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
You've always wondered what was just beyond the doors of the spooky house at the end of the block. Now, make it your very own.

Choose your witch archetype:

Enchanter: use crystals and stones to cleanse auras and promote positive well-being.

Goth: draw on ancient knowledge with blood, tears, and artistry.

Hag: with woodwork and an oven, anything is possible.

Herbalist: potions, poisons, and a gift for all things green.

Occultist: see beyond the veil with gifts of loved ones long gone.

Choose a familiar.

Create your home.

Created for Folklore Jam 2020, Rainbow Jam 2020, and Witch Jam, The Coven at the End of the Lane is a dice pool game of spell casting, tarot, and community.
boardgame.rpg: The Coven at the End of the Lane

boardgame.name: The Blue Lotus Hack
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
And welcome to The Blue Lotus Hack! Inside the pages of this Black Hack variant, you'll find:


New classes and variants of the original Black Hack classes
Magic spells and psychic gifts
Scores of monsters
Dozens of enchanted items
And a mini campaign setting, the southern reaches of the continent of Varas, a world marked by the scars of an ancient immortals' war and the incursion of the Pale Lords and their soul-eating ephemeral hordes.

boardgame.name: 乙未戰爭 (Japanese Conquest of Taiwan)
boardgame.description: "Japanese Conquest of Taiwan" is a postcard wargame, inheriting the game system of "800 Heroes: Defense of Sihang Warehouse". Players play as the commander of the Democratic Republic of Taiwan (Taiwan Army) and the Japanese Empire (Japanese Army). Both sides take turns using the rotating action points to move, attack or retreat. There are 6 turns in the game, and the Japanese army must occupy a total of 5 areas at the end.

boardgame.name: 好漢日記 (Nice Guy Diary)
boardgame.description:
A card game of "Water Margin", one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_Margin
Out of the story of the novel, this game expresses a big battle and a hot bond by 108 heroes.
108 cards
1 turn marker
3 round markers
2 dice
2 pages of rules
1 player's guide

boardgame.name: Omeganaut
boardgame.description:
Omeganaut is a rail shooter in the vein of Starfox with randomly generated levels and level progression. It features simple graphics and no music, which the developer points out makes it possible to fit any version of the game on a floppy disk.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Kamigawa: Neon Dynasty
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering takes place in the world of Kamigawa, approximately 1200 years after the end of the Kami War. Technology has developed significantly in that time, and the art now has a neon cyberpunk aesthetic inspired by modern-day Japan. There are giant mechs, laser katanas, cyber ninjas, and more.

The set contains 302 cards: 117 commons, 88 uncommons, 59 rares, 18 mythic rares, and 20 basic lands (10 of which are in a unique full-art Ukiyo-e style inspired by traditional Japanese woodcuts). It is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles.

Introducing a novel system such as the abolition of the map and the replacement of the attacking side by interception, to express the battle that "movement is understandable".

boardgame.name: 関ヶ原無双 (Sekigahara Warriors)
boardgame.description:
Sekigahara Warriors is a simulation game that reproduces the "Battle of Sekigahara", the biggest battle in Japan's Sengoku period.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sekigahara
The map was cut from the foot of Mt. Momokubari in the east to Fuwa no Seki in the west, from Mt. Sasao in the north to Mt. Matsuo in the south. The victory condition includes the element of "betrayal" that is indispensable for the battle of Sekigahara, and players can enjoy purely clashes between units.
In order to create the atmosphere of the battle at that time, the battle logic is extremely deformed for a simulation game of this scale. In other words, the front side of the piece expresses the ability as a unit, but when it is damaged and becomes the back side, it expresses the ability of the individual military commander. In terms of wargames, the front side is the operational level and the back side is the tactical level. If the soldiers are lost due to damage, the military commander will fight directly.
There is also a twist on the victory conditions. The point is that "when the military commander retreats, Kobayakawa's heart shakes."

boardgame.name: ソリティア関ヶ原の戦い (Solitaire Battle of Sekigahara)
boardgame.description:
The player play the main Battle of Sekigahara as a commander of the Western Army. The Eastern Army is controlled by the game system and attacks / counterattacks according to the rules. This system is partly based on the system of VPG's The Barbarossa Campaign.
It is said that the Battle of Sekigahara was won by the betrayal of Kobayakawa Hideaki and others of the Western Army. Therefore, when making a game, the elements of the politicking for the army of Kobayakawa Hideaki and others are usually included. However, this was an element that was prone to system problems, such as complicating the game system and allowing players who know the historical facts of betrayal to take measures against betrayal in advance.
Therefore, this game focused on "the salvo of guns on Mt. Matsuo by the Ieyasu main corps" that triggered Kobayakawa Hideaki to finally implement the betrayal. The game defines that Ieyasu gets impatient and starts advancing = betrayal = defeat of the Western Army, and sets the victory condition that the Western Army is defeated if the victory or defeat is not decided "until the Ieyasu main corps starts advancing".
This is a fairly high hurdle for the Western Army, but it is a victory condition unique to solitaire that you can challenge as many times as you want without having to secure an opponent. Try to challenge the if of history.

boardgame.name: Winds of Caribbean
boardgame.description:
Winds of Caribbean is a naval battle-themed game of sailing ships during the Age of Discovery, based on the system of the masterpiece Wings of War: Dawn of War. Players control sailboats, shoot cannons, and sometimes come alongside to fight and aim for victory.
The big difference between Wings of War and Winds of Caribbean is that the former has the same direction of movement and attack, while the later has different directions of movement and attack. The theory of naval battles during the age of sail was to face the enemy on the side where the cannons were lined up, and this game also reproduced that. You can experience a different battle from the air battle, such as how to switch between movement and attack. In addition, the cannon reflects the performance of the time, it requires loading of bullets for each attack and the rapid fire does not work, and if the ship moves violently, the hit rate will drop or it will not be possible to load. It also includes the element that if a fire breaks out due to being hit, the fire must be extinguished. When ships collide with each other, side-to-side battle (aboldage) also occurs. Some ships are better at this, so pirate style is also possible.
The feature of the component is that the display such as loading of bullets and decrease of hit rate is set to "character + lines". It is also an expression that the commander's ability and command occupy a large weight in the naval battle at that time.
There are three types of ships: caravel, carrack, and small galleon.

boardgame.name: リーダーズアイドル (Leader's Idol)
boardgame.description:
Leader's Idol is a table game with character development elements. The number of players is 2-4. The player will be in the position of the public relations manager of the Leaders Company and will carry out PR activities for the company. This PR plan includes making subordinates public relations idols, and it is important for players how to make their idols active.

The outcome of the game is determined by the total number of PR points earned at the end of the game. PR points are listed for each public relations plan (project card) that is the center of the progress of the game, and these cards can be obtained by "auction". There are 24 types of projects, and the points and contents are different, but a "budget" is required to compete for these, and the speed at which these budgets can be recovered depends on the abilities of each idol. If you spend a lot of time collecting your budget, no matter how big a project you get, you may lose to another company that has more projects.

In addition, some projects may have synergistic effects with other projects, and some may affect subsequent activities. For example, the "manner training" card has 0 PR points, but it has the effect of improving the "social" ability. Therefore, planning is important for how to use the budget, and it is also necessary to consider when to incorporate training such as compensating for the weaknesses of the character / developing the strengths.

In addition, some projects may have synergistic effects with other projects, and some may affect subsequent activities. For example, the "manner training" card has 0 PR points, but it has the effect of improving the "social" ability. Therefore, planning is important for how to use the budget, and it is also necessary to consider when to incorporate training such as compensating for the weaknesses of the character / developing the strengths.

For that reason, it is a game that you can enjoy the public relations simulation side, where the rules are simple but planning is important.

boardgame.name: Cat Collection Card Game
ねこあつめカードゲーム
boardgame.description:
Cat Collection Card Game is a table game that can be played from the lower grades of elementary school. You can play from 2 to 4 people at once.

The game includes cards that represent cats and items. Players use item cards to compete for how to bring cats to their place.
There are cats such as stray cat, boss cat, tortoiseshell cat, celebrity cat, etc. and some of them have different favorite items as well as abilities. Each cat has a score, and the player who collects a certain number of points wins the game. There is a difference in the score between a cat that can be caught by one mouse and a celebrity cat with a pedigree, and there are also compatibility between cats, so it is important to think about how to collect them.

Items are replenished from the deck, but some are easy to get and some are not, and some items have special effects, so planning is important. However, happenings such as stray cats and crows may appear, so it does not go exactly as planned. The rules are simple in a game like picture matching, but there are also elements of
replay.

Play time is about 15 minutes. Planning is important when playing with two people, and reading the flow of the place and a little luck is important when playing with four people.

This game has no relations with a mobile cat collecting game "Neko Atsume".

boardgame.name: Coral Sea Decisive Battle Card Game
珊瑚海決戦カードゲーム
boardgame.description:
Coral Sea Decisive Battle Card Game is a two-player card game with the motif of the first aircraft carrier-to-aircraft carrier confrontation that took place in 1942 during the Pacific War. Players will fight in the position of commander of the Japanese task force centered on the aircraft carriers Zuikaku and Shokaku, or the commander of the US task force centered on the aircraft carriers Lexington and Yorktown.

Battles between aircraft carriers include elements such as searching for enemy locations, air defense plans, and the formation and rotation of attack units. While covering these elements, I tried to reproduce the air and naval battle at that time with a system that was as simple as possible like a card game. The game also includes the presence of friendly forces, geographical advantages, and technical differences such as radar.
Especially the search for enemy is the heart of this game. By repeating the search for enemy, the location of the enemy will gradually be narrowed down, but it is the same for the opponent. It's better to find the enemy early, but you also have to think about defense. You will feel the excitement because you do not know the movement of the opponent.

boardgame.name: Senryaku-Daimyo
戦略大名
boardgame.description:
Senryaku-Daimyo is a board game for 3 to 4 players who aims to prosper in their own country by taking the position of a daimyo during the Sengoku period.

When you think of a game during the Sengoku period, you might think of a battle for territory without humanity and justice, but this "Senryaku-Daimyo" includes not only "battle" but also territorial management elements such as commerce and industrial development. You can enjoy the trade-in that suits your style.

The starting line at the start of the game is the same for all players. The number of territories, economic power, and human assets are the same. From there, players will continue to prosper their country while acquiring cards for their policies and territories. You may focus on industrial development such as "hydraulic control" and "land survey", or you may focus on commercial promotion such as "free trade" and "money casting". Of course, you may expand your territory and make your country bigger by the battle unique to the Sengoku period. Ultimately, who enriched the country the most is determined by the total number of victory points on those cards, so it's completely up to you what direction you're aiming for.

Of course, among the routes mentioned above, the expansion of the territory has a great deal of economic gain, which greatly contributes to victory. However, the act of relying on force is not unrelated to the interference of other countries. In addition, events such as storms and floods and riots occur suddenly, so territorial management does not go as planned. Sometimes it will be necessary to make bold use of human resources during the Sengoku period.

Is it possible to outsmart the speculation of other countries and build the richest country in Japan?

boardgame.name: キャッツバトル (Cats Battle)
boardgame.description:
This is a card game for 2 to 4 players who compete for fish cards using the cat cards in their hand.

The flow of the game is as simple as choosing one of the cat cards in your hand for your turn. However, cat cards have various effects, such as drawing cards from the deck, forcing other players to exchange cards, and pressing unwanted cards. Occasionally, there will be a "power comparison" where you can get a card by comparing the strength of the cat and winning! When the deck runs out, the game ends, and the victory or defeat is determined by the total points written on the fish card at that time.

The feature of this game is that everyone starts the game with the same number of fish cards. Some fish cards range from high scores to negative points, and it is unknown who started the game with how many points.

As the game progresses, you will gradually see who is best to play against and who is best to exchange cards with. It is a card game that children and adults can easily play, guessing in the hands of other players and bargaining which card to leave last.

boardgame.name: 桶狭間戦棋 (Okehazama-Senki)
boardgame.description:
Okehazama-Senki is a historical war simulation game that reproduces the battle between Oda Nobunaga and Imagawa Yoshimoto on May 19, 1560.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okehazama
The number of players is 2, the number of pieces is 48, and the play time is 60 to 90 minutes. The player will be in the position of Oda Nobunaga or Imagawa Yoshimoto, aiming for victory.

In Okehazama-Senki, you can try different unit arrangements from the historical facts, and it is designed so that both Oda side and Imagawa side can try various strategies.

boardgame.name: Charadspelet för barn
boardgame.description:
Charadspelet för barn is a charade game for kids. Each round one player draw one orange and one purple card from the two decks. On each card there is a picture. On the orange cards there is characters, eg ghost, trumpet player, waiter. On the purple card there is a chore, eg brush teeth, waves, is at the cinema. The player will try to show with movements what the pictures show. The other players try to guess. The player that first guess the whole solution will roll the number die and do cross off that many stars on their board. So does also the player that did the charade. If no one guessed right before the hourglass is empty no star are crossed over. The turn gets clockwise on to the next player.

The first player to cross off the last space on their board is the winner.

If your playing with older kids there is also three words on the cards that can be used instead. To determine which words to use there is two dice to roll.

boardgame.name: ダンジョン＆ダンゲロス (Dungeon & Dangerous)
boardgame.description:
ダンジョン＆ダンゲロス (Dungeon & Dangerous) is a dungeon crawl game from Japan, aimed at older players. Players are the students of a school that discover a monster-filled dungeon in the basement of their school. Aided by faculty and staff, students and friends, they explore the dungeon and defeat the various demons and creatures below. Their goal is to find a secret legendary book somewhere in the dungeon.

The game is designed to be played multiple times, with one to four players if playing co-op. Players choose from eight different characters With modular components, abundant friends to choose from, and a variety of scenarios, the game also includes online elements to maintain the uncertainty and suspense.

Subsequent to its publication, the designer has created more characters and scenarios to be found online.

A DX edition was published originally which gave more characters, six more scenarios and a guidebook and reference material to enable players to build their own characters and scenarios.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Kagami Kyosuke Works (架神恭介ワークス)
boardgame.boardgameartist: Jigoku no Misawa (地獄のミサワ)

boardgame.name: HAKONE
boardgame.description:
HAKONE is a coastal town in Japan, lying some 100km southwest of Tokyo. It is famous for hosting the Hakone Ekiden, a two day, five marathon road-race. Ekiden, long distance road racing, is a very popular sport in Japan, and the Hakone Ekiden is notoriously hard, with five legs run from central Tokyo out to Hakone on day one, and then five legs run back to central Tokyo on day two. Each leg is over 20km, and the race is run by teams of university students.

In the dice game Hakone, players are coaching their university team to win the Hakone Ekiden. Each leg is run by different athletes, and the coach must select the best one to suit the stage. The athlete cards show their abilities, their time over 10k, how they do at climbing or descending, against the wind or sea breezes. In addition, the players use special action cards to improve their performance, or nobble the opposition.

The dice are used as in Catan, with one dice roll applying to all runners. The courses are printed on cloths and there are eight university teams to choose from.
user summary

boardgame.name: HAKONE 拡張カード (HAKONE expansion cards)
boardgame.description:
HAKONE 拡張カード (HAKONE expansion cards) is a very limited edition of expansion cards to HAKONE. There are only 90 copies sold. The pack includes new university teams with matching pieces, new runners including foreign students, new event cards.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Academies of the Arcane
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Learning is compulsory — if you want to survive!

Academies of the Arcane contains robust tools to create your very own magical school, the kind that provides the finest education one could hope to find among the myriad spheres beneath the hump-backed sky. Inside, you’ll find strange locales, mystical campus enclaves, fresh-faced & foolhardy students and their pedigreed houses, ever-scheming staff members trapped within the ivory tower of academia, and classes covering every topic a would-be sorcerer could dream of!

Featuring 36 new Backgrounds, 90 Spells, ample advice for running the frivolous competitions of wizards and their brutal errantries to other worlds, this peerless tome has all you need to construct your ideal school of sorcery!

boardgame.name: ギルドビルド (Guild Build)
boardgame.description:
In ギルドビルド (Guild Build), players work to build an adventuring party in a fantasy world of anthropomorphic bird people. Characters include familiar roles such as Mage, Warrior, Cleric, and Crafter. Having the right party members allows you to score victory points through quests, events, and special achievements.

On a player's turn, they select one of five quest cards: Conquer, Defend, Gather, Explore, and Recruit. Conquer, Defend, and Gather allow you to score points on different score tracks, which allow you to earn Feat Cards. Explore let you draw an Event Card, which causes players to gain or lose resources based on their party members. Recruit allows you to hire party members with coins from the current market.

Players can earn victory points from advancing on the score tracks to earn Feat Cards, from all of their party members, and from Legendary Cards earned from collecting certain party members or fifteen coins.

The game ends when a player gains a certain number of party members, which varies based on the number of players. The player with the most victory points at that time is the winner.

boardgame.name: Goodman Games Gazette (Volume 1, Number 8 - March 2017)
boardgame.description:
Goodman Games Gazette
Volume 1 - Number 8
March 2017

Includes the micro-adventure "Attack of the Plane Jumper"
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Pioneering the First 100-Sided Die Braking System

boardgame.name: Holotype: Mesozoic North America
boardgame.description:
A fast-paced light-strategy worker placement board game about paleontology for 2-5 players.

Players use their Paleontologist, Grad Student and Field Assistant workers to gather fossils, do research and publish new Dinosaurs and Marine Reptiles as Holotypes. Personal and semi-collaborative Global Objectives feature modern paleontology concepts such as cladistics and taxonomy.

The player with the most Victory Points from publishing Holotypes, completing Personal Objectives and contributing to Global Objectives wins.

boardgame.name: Nersha: Playmat
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:

THE PLAYMAT MADE FOR NERSHA

This playmat makes it easier for players to arrange the map tiles on the table while also keeping them away from spills.

FEATURES
- 18"×18" square
- 2mm thick
- Cloth front, neoprene back
- Durable and wrinkle-resistant
- May be gently cleaned with soap and water

From the Kickstarter:

"This playmat is 18"x18" and 2mm thick. It has a tough cloth front and neoprene back. It's wrinkle and spill-resistant, and it's a great playing surface for Nersha. It has room for up to 8 tiles in either direction with a 1" border around the edges."

boardgame.name: Claim the Sky
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book, and the publisher website.

When things are at their worst, heroes rise!

When menace looms, the best among us don’t flee danger—they face it. With might and powers beyond that of mere mortals, they stand before the forces of injustice with confidence. They leap into dark and daunting dangers. They slip the bonds of gravity and soar. They claim the sky itself!

In a world that could use a few heroes now more than ever, you can join their ranks. Claim the Sky takes the Cypher System into the realm of superheroes, with rules, character options, genre advice, and a complete, ready-to-use setting that makes the most of the superhero genre.

Whether creating your own heroes or playing your favorites from comics or movies, Claim the Sky makes you the hero. Inside this book you’ll find:


Dozens of superhero rules and options, including foci, descriptors, and abilities—plus new power shift and power stunt rules
Detailed advice for creating speedsters, gadgeteers, elastic heroes, powered-armor heroes, heroes who shrink or grow, master martial artists, shapechangers, and other superhero archetypes
Guidelines for building the most popular superhero archetypes from comics and movies
50 fully statted heroes and villains, complete with powers and personalities
In-depth discussions of common superhero themes (aliens, magic, mutants, time travel) and comic book stories (origin stories, team-ups, superhero bases, secret identities, nemeses), along with advice for creating realistic, comic-book style, or far-future superhero settings, and even tips for naming superpowered characters
The detailed Boundless setting, plus three complete superhero adventures for use in Boundless or your own campaign


Claim the Sky is a setting and supplement for the Cypher System. Requires the Cypher System Rulebook for play.

boardgame.name: Nersha: Capstones
boardgame.description:
From the KS:

Capstones are extra pieces you set on top of other stones to keep track of the last piece you moved. These have a unique themed design printed on them. Only available during the Kickstarter.

1 black capstone, 1 white capstone

boardgame.name: Hope Lost
boardgame.description:
Hope Lost is a 2-4 player cooperative choose-your-own-apocalypse game, featuring 6 different apocalypses to play through, each with their own objective and unique spin to the game’s common mechanics. Players will need to fight the apocalypses as well as time itself, all the while trying to make sure the survivors at the base have everything they need. Will you survive the apocalypse, or is all hope lost?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Wiggles SNAP! CARDS
boardgame.description:
Goal: to SNAP! Up as many cards as you can and be the last player with cards left after all the other players have run out of cards.
Instructions: Shuffle the deck of 36 cards and deal an equal amount to each player which they place in front of them in a face down pile.
Each player takes turns placing a card from the top of their pile face up in the centre of the table. Whenever two matching cards are placed on top of each other the first player to shout “wiggles SNAP!” collects the centre cards and puts them face down below their pile.
When a player runs out of cards they are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

boardgame.name: Teenage Angst
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Teenage Angst is a solo scrapbooking TTRPG about being a teenager with a lot of feelings, obsessed with a single song that speaks to them so intimately that they feel like it was written specifically for them.

You choose your scenario, one of the 10 songs that were chosen for the game, you create your character - a teenager - and by scrapbooking and listening to the song from your scenario in a loop, you resolve the prompts. By the end, you'll have some pages of a scrapbook that belongs to a teenager, who might or might not remind you to yourself some years ago.

boardgame.name: Yourself
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Yourfelf is a solo tabletop role playing game about Introspection, Identity, and Heritage. You play as a character who has discovered they are a Changeling, a fae amongst humans, and through the game you will explore changes, challenges, joy, and most importantly what it means to be Yourself.

You will go through 5 Acts answering questions and prompts to figure yourself out through your past, your present, and your hopes for future.

boardgame.name: Am-Duat
boardgame.description:
A Mahjong variant themed to ancient Egypt, players draft tiles from a pyramid of face-down tiles and replace their starting 'book' of 16 tiles in order to complete mosaic sets (2, 3 and 4 pieces).

When a player has a full set of 'completed' mosaics OR the discard pile - a pyramid that builds up during play - the round ends and proceeds to scoring.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Kaukaz 2020
boardgame.description:
Zapad 2020 is a small game released in the World War 3 system, published in the 43 issue of the Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

Game covers hypothetical operation of the Russian army at Ukraine 2020, where Russians are trying to seize the important dam in the New Kachovka city, that controls the water supply to the Crimea.

Kaukaz comes with new counters (of Russians and Ukrainians) and small board, covering the battle area. Some additional markers are included as well. Set of the rules of WW3 system is needed.

boardgame.name: Battles of Medieval Britain: A Solitaire Wargame
boardgame.description:
Battles of Medieval Britain covers battles fought between the year 937 and 1403. By modern standards, the forces on each side were small in size, but battles were fierce and bloody and were no place for the faint-hearted. In many cases the exact details of the battle have never been fully established, including what weapons were used, the scale of the armies on each side, and even exactly where the battles took place. The battles in this book are representations of the actual battles they depict, and in some cases deliberate changes or additions have been made to add to the play experience. But they will provide some idea of what happened at each Battle, and allow the Player to try to reproduce, or recreate, history.

The aim of this book is to present a clear, accessible, and quick to learn game, so that players can get into the action quickly. It provides plenty of replayability due to the random set up of the initial forces and composition and location of reinforcements.

This book is a solitaire wargame. You play the game, and the book will provide the “enemy”. You will need at least 4, but preferably 6, standard six-sided dice.

In the game, the Player will be commanding various units, often representing many hundreds of men each, seeking to achieve various Objectives. Key battles from different years are included, although all fall into what is generally referred to as the medieval period. The Player will control various different armies and units depending on the battle.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Raid: Asgard Expansion
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Raid, including:

2 each of 3 new God cards (6)
2 each of a new power rune card (2)
2 each of 5 new weather cards (10)
12 each of 3 new elite warrior cards (24)
4 sided fate die

boardgame.name: Sakura Arms: Promotional Vigor Cards
boardgame.description: Contains 18 promotional vigor cards for Sakura Arms, one for each goddess included in the first three boxes. Each card replaces the basic artless vigor card with a card featuring the goddess (as an SD character).

boardgame.name: looK INside
boardgame.description:
looK INside is an episodic narrative game in 2.5D based on the interactions that the player performs in a book summarizing in pictures and texts the life of a French family at different times and periods in the life of its members.

You play as Manon, the youngest of a French family of whom she knows little. When she discovers a book in the attic of her parents' house, she will then be immersed in life stories.

The goal for Manon is to get to know her family through all the periods in which she has not known them and to reconstruct a complete family tree located on the first page of the book.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Crypto: Against All Odds
boardgame.description:
Crypto Against All Odds takes inspiration from the original classic Plants vs. Zombies game. This time, instead of battling hungry zombies in your backyard, you will be commanding a squad of crypto defenders to fight against various blockchain threats (bugs, hackers, 51% attack, ransomware, etc.), collectively known as the FUD army (Fear. Uncertainty. Doubt).

Defend with Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and unlock many other favorite cryptos as you progress. Acquire powerful fiat abilities, customize your squad, and HODL the line!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Kaikoro
boardgame.description:
In Kaikoro you'll face five powerful Kaijus while defending the last city of the earth. Use the dice to attack them, get victory points and combine powerful combos to defeat them before the other players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Starsmith
boardgame.description:
In the dice-rolling battle game Starsmith, you are constellations dueling over elements in the galaxy in order to build your own stars. What will be your strategy: capturing, stealing, or performing fusion/fission?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wortblitz Junior Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
A game with 50 round cards in a tin box. Each card has a letter and a category.

The players have to find a word which starts with the letter of the first card and belongs to the category of the second card. The player who finds a valid word first, collects the card, uncovers and reads the next pair of letter and category.

The player with the most gathered cards wins the game.

This is the children's version of the game Wort Blitz Kartenspiel.

boardgame.name: One Word
boardgame.description: Nine dice with pictures on the sides are thrown. The active player must find a single word that combines the two (or optionally three) dice on his card. The other players try to guess the dice from the given word. If a player guesses incorrectly, they are not allowed to guess again this round. If a player guesses correctly, they get the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
